I'll create a basic todo app with backend API and frontend UI. Let me start by planning the implementation.

<artifact type="text" title="Todo App Implementation Plan">
Todo App Features:
1. Backend API with FastAPI for CRUD operations on todos
2. Frontend UI with React to display and manage todos
3. Todo model with id, title, completed status
4. Pages: Todo list, add todo form
5. Integration between frontend and backend

Backend Structure:
- Model: Todo (id, title, completed)
- Service: todo_service.py with CRUD operations
- API Routes: GET /todos/, POST /todos/, PUT /todos/{id}/, DELETE /todos/{id}/

Frontend Structure:
- TodoListPage: Display todos with completion toggle and delete
- AddTodoForm: Form to add new todos
- TodoService: API calls to backend
- Types: Todo interface
</artifact>

Let's start by creating the backend todo model:

<action type="file" filePath="backend/models/todo.py">
from pydantic import BaseModel
from typing import Optional
from datetime import datetime

class TodoBase(BaseModel):
    title: str
    completed: bool = False

class TodoCreate(TodoBase):
    pass

class TodoUpdate(TodoBase):
    pass

class Todo(TodoBase):
    id: int
    
    class Config:
        from_attributes = True
</action>

<action_result type="create_file_realtime" file_path="backend/models/todo.py">

✅ File 'backend/models/todo.py' created.

3. Run the test file with `python backend/test_api.py`
4. Fix any runtime errors
5. Delete the test file when done

Continue with your implementation and testing.


</action_result>
